newsitem.title: USA: Power marketers providing PSE&G coal.
newsitem.headline: Power marketers providing PSE&G coal.

text.p: Public Service Electric & Gas Co is selling 600 megawatts of power from its Hudson generating plant under two coal tolling agreements, spokesman Paul Lief Rosengren said Monday.
Under a tolling agreement, the coal is provided by the power marketer, which then pays a fixed fee -- or toll -- to generate electricity from that coal for sale elsewhere.
An LG&E Energy Corp spokesman said one of the contracts, for 300 megawatts of power, is with LG&E.
He noted the company is the third largest U.S. power marketer.
It is the number one power marketer in the area served by the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland interconnection.
The power being produced by the Public Service Enterprise Group Inc utility subsidiary is being sold to LG&E customers in the PJM market area, the spokesman said.
